title: Our 15 Most Popular Indian Recipes
description: Cooking your favorite Indian dishes at home can be a fun experience. Visit your local Indian grocery store, grab some new spices or ingredients, and tie on your apron. From butter chicken to saag paneer, these are the dishes our readers search for the most often. You can learn to make your own naan, seasoning blends, and even desserts with this helpful collection of recipes.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Our 15 Most Popular Indian Recipes By Hayley Sugg Updated on November 30, 2021 Close Credits: John Cooking your favorite Indian dishes at home can be a fun experience. Visit your local Indian grocery store, grab some new spices or ingredients, and tie on your apron. From butter chicken to saag paneer, these are the dishes our readers search for the most often. You can learn to make your own naan, seasoning blends, and even desserts with this helpful collection of recipes. 01 of 16 Indian Chicken Curry View Recipe Save farynhite This creamy curry sauce is perfect for cooking chicken in until its fall-apart tender. "I used this recipe when I made curry myself for the first time ever," says Nadia Orawski. "I loved it!" 02 of 16 Naan View Recipe Save John A leavened flatbread, naan completes any Indian meal. Use it for sopping up sauces, drizzle with chutney, or just eat as-is. 03 of 16 Red Lentil Curry View Recipe Save Lea Eats This vegetarian curry is incredibly thick and rich, thanks to cooked-down red lentils. For serving, spoon over rice or scoop up with flatbreads. 04 of 16 Kheer (Rice Pudding) View Recipe Save Michelle Marques Coconut and dairy milk combine for a doubly creamy dessert. "This recipe makes very nice kheer. The coconut milk is a creative addition that really enhanced the flavor," says user annebonannie. 05 of 16 Chicken Makhani (Indian Butter Chicken) View Recipe Save melissao The ultimate decadent curry, murgh makhani relies on heavy cream and butter for its rich texture. It's extra saucy, so be sure to serve it with a side of naan, rice, or both to soak up the sauce. 06 of 16 Chana Masala (Savory Indian Chick Peas) View Recipe Save Elizabeth Faranda You can get curry in a hurry by using canned chickpeas for convenience. As a bonus, this recipe also happens to be vegan-friendly and gluten-free. 07 of 16 Indian Style Basmati Rice View Recipe Save Indian Style Basmati Rice. Hungrymom13 By subbing spiced rice for steamed rice, you'll have an even more flavorful meal. "I love this rice!" says heathery. "I am awful at cooking rice and it usually ends up gummy and sticky, but this recipe produced rice like I'd buy in an Indian restaurant." 08 of 16 Gulab Jamun View Recipe Save Kristin Sims Gulab jamun are tender pieces of fried dough simmered in a rose water syrup to infuse them with floral flavors. 09 of 16 Indian Tandoori Chicken View Recipe Save Montana By marinating chicken overnight in a spiced yogurt mix, you're sure to have flavor in every bite. If you like, replace the food coloring with a dash of turmeric and a little paprika. 10 of 16 Vegetarian Korma View Recipe Save Daniel Snoozy Potatoes, cashews, peas, and peppers lend a world of flavors and textures to this curry dish. Recipe reviewer cwprice says, "A great korma. Just as good as our favorite Indian restaurant makes, and not as heavy." 11 of 16 Indian Chapati Bread View Recipe Save Tomáš Chytil Five ingredients are all you need to whip out these tender Indian flatbreads. A quick trip to the skillet and after thirty seconds on both sides, you'll be rewarded with a delicious side dish. 12 of 16 Easy Garam Masala View Recipe Save Veronica Miller Although it's traditionally made from whole spices that are then toasted and blended, this recipe for garam masala relies on pre-ground spices for a quick and easy version. 13 of 16 Authentic Saag Paneer View Recipe Save Michele Blau In this recipe, creamy spinach curry is mixed with paneer (a firm Indian cheese) after being fried until perfectly crisp. "This turned out great!" says user Shelly Davis. "Easily as good as what I've had in many restaurants." 14 of 16 Beef Samosas View Recipe Save lili Potatoes and beef, along with a punch of spices, are the base for these hearty pastries. Don't forget to serve them with a side of chutney for dipping! 15 of 16 Aloo Matar View Recipe Save Kathy Howard This vegetarian-friendly main dish features potatoes and peas that are cooked down in a spiced tomato sauce until tender. 16 of 16 State of Home Cooking: Appetite for Adventure and Cultural Heritage We're serving up and celebrating the biggest home-cooking trends from the most enthusiastic cooks we know: our community. We crunched the data from 1.2 billion annual Allrecipes.com visits and 2.5 billion annual page views. Then we dug even further, surveying Allrecipes cooks about what's in their carts and fridges, on their stovetops and tables, and on their minds. Appetite for Adventure and Cultural Heritage is just one of the topics they're most curious about. See more of the "State of Home Cooking" special report. Explore more: Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Indian Was this page helpful? Thanks for your feedback! Tell us why!
